Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: The student can draw basic shapes or figures that might represent animals or plants but lack detail or clarity.
The student may attempt to show a simple animal like a fish or a bird but without integrating it into a habitat.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to draw specific habitat details (e.g., water, trees) or integrate them with animals *(student doesn't know this)*.
Labeling is mostly or entirely absent, or if present, incorrect or random *(student doesn't understand purpose of labels)*.
The student struggles to show any relationship between animals and their environments (e.g., placing a fish on land) *(student doesn't grasp habitats)*.
Fails to demonstrate how resources support the animal's life *(student doesnâ€™t know what resources do)*.
Drawings do not reflect any systematic interaction between living things and their environments *(student does not understand concept of ecosystem)*.
